entry.def: A stand-off is a situation in which neither of two opposing groups or forces will make a move until the other one does something, so nothing can happen until one of them gives way.

example.ex: There is no sign of an end to the stand-off between Mohawk Indians and the Quebec provincial police...
example.tran: 莫霍克印第安人和魁北克省警方之间的僵持局面仍没有结束的迹象。

example.ex: The State Department was warning that this could lead to another diplomatic stand-off.
example.tran: 国务院警告说这可能会引发新的外交僵局。

means.word_mean: 1. the finish of a contest in which the score is tied and the winner is undecided;

sentences.sentence: "their record was 3 wins, 6 losses and a tie"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of repulsing or repelling an attack; a successful defensive stand
